alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Mathews (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Gloucester and Mathews Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gloucester Courthouse, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mobjack and Blakes around 610 PM EDT. Mathews and Bavon around 615 PM EDT. Gwynn around 620 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ruff, Beulah, Moon, Laban, Glass, Naxera, Fort Nonsense, North, Soles and Port Haywood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern Virginia.
